quotes.quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
School prepares you for the real world... which also bites.
What is the most important thing one learns in school? Self-esteem, support, and friendship.
It is not who you attend school with but who controls the school you attend.
School is a place that provides education and education is the key to life.
The fundamental purpose of school is learning, not teaching.
In school, you learn how to learn.
I think school is a place where thinking should be taught.
You can't learn in school what the world is going to do next year.
It's a mistake to think that once you're done with school you need never learn anything new.
Jails and prisons are the complement of schools; so many less as you have of the latter, so many more must you have of the former.
The chief reason for going to school is to get the impression fixed for life that there is a book side for everything.
If there were no schools to take the children away from home part of the time, the insane asylums would be filled with mothers.
In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.
Cheating in school is a form of self-deception. We go to school to learn. We cheat ourselves when we coast on the efforts and scholarship of someone else.
What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education.
School made us 'literate' but did not teach us to read for pleasure.
School should be the best party in town.
There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library.
The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means of education.
We don't stop going to school when we graduate.
I'm not going to school just for the academics - I wanted to share ideas, to be around people who are passionate about learning.
Every time you stop a school, you will have to build a jail. What you gain at one end you lose at the other. It's like feeding a dog on his own tail. It won't fatten the dog.
I never let my schooling interfere with my education.
There is a grave defect in the school where the playground suggests happy and classroom disagreeable thoughts.
If the school sends out children with a desire for knowledge and some idea of how to acquire and use it, it will have done its work.
You don't appreciate a lot of stuff in school until you get older. Little things like being spanked every day by a middle aged woman: Stuff you pay good money for in later life.
We class schools into four grades: leading school, first-rate school, good school and school.
The pathway to educational excellence lies within each school.
Experience keeps a dear school, but fools will learn in no other.
